maml:description.maml:para: Adds a CLR assembly to the specified server or database
Adds a CLR assembly to the specified server or database
This is the Name which the assembly is known by in Analysis Services
This is the path and file name of the .dll file for the assembly
This is the Database object to which you want to add the assembly
This is the Name which the assembly is known by in Analysis Services
This is the path and file name of the .dll file for the assembly
If the assembly is to be loaded under a particular database you can specify it's name with this parameter.
This is the server object for where the assembly is to be loaded. You can either use pass in a server object or use the ServerName parameter.
This is the Name which the assembly is known by in Analysis Services
This is the path and file name of the .dll file for the assembly
If the assembly is to be loaded under a particular database you can specify it's name with this parameter.
This is the name of the server to which the assembly is to be loaded. You can either use this parameter or pass a Server object to the Server parameter.

This is the name of the server to which the assembly is to be loaded. You can either use this parameter or pass a Server object to the Server parameter.
Cancels the specified SSAS session.
This is the Guid for the session to be cancelled.
The name of the server against which to run the cancel session command.
The SPID number to cancel. You can either use the SPID or SessionId parameter to identify a session
A Session object can be passed in on the pipeline or as a parameter
Add this flag causes the cmdlet not to perform the cancel command, but just to print out what the results of the command would have been.
This parameter will cause the cmdlet to confirm the action of clearing the session before it is taken.
This is the Guid for the session to be cancelled.
The name of the server against which to run the cancel session command.
The SPID number to cancel. You can either use the SPID or SessionId parameter to identify a session
Add this flag causes the cmdlet not to perform the cancel command, but just to print out what the results of the command would have been.
This parameter will cause the cmdlet to confirm the action of clearing the session before it is taken.
This is the Guid for the session to be cancelled.
The name of the server against which to run the cancel session command.
The SPID number to cancel. You can either use the SPID or SessionId parameter to identify a session

This parameter will cause the cmdlet to confirm the action of clearing the session before it is taken.
This is the Guid for the session to be cancelled.
The name of the server against which to run the cancel session command.
The SPID number to cancel. You can either use the SPID or SessionId parameter to identify a session
A Session object can be passed in on the pipeline or as a parameter
Add this flag causes the cmdlet not to perform the cancel command, but just to print out what the results of the command would have been.
This parameter will cause the cmdlet to confirm the action of clearing the session before it is taken.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears the session associated with SPID 1234

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a collection of all the SSAS connections. for the specified server
Specifying an Id will cause this cmdlet to only return the connection object for that single connection.
The name of the Database
This is the name of the server for which to return a list of connections.
Specifying an Id will cause this cmdlet to only return the connection object for that single connection.
This is the server object for which to return a list of connections. You can pass this parameter in on the pipeline.
Specifying an Id will cause this cmdlet to only return the connection object for that single connection.
The name of the Database
This is the name of the server for which to return a list of connections.
This is the server object for which to return a list of connections. You can pass this parameter in on the pipeline.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns a list of connections from the localhost server.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of cube objects
This is the database object from which to list the cubes.
This is the name of the SSAS server.
This is the name of the SSAS Database.

This specifies the name of the cube to return, this parameter is optional and if not included all cubes in the database will be returned. This parameter also supports wildcards to allow for selecting a set of cubes whose name matches a specific pattern.
This is the database object from which to list the cubes.
This is the name of the SSAS server.
This is the name of the SSAS Database.

This specifies the name of the cube to return, this parameter is optional and if not included all cubes in the database will be returned. This parameter also supports wildcards to allow for selecting a set of cubes whose name matches a specific pattern.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return the cube object for the Adventure Works cube in the Adventure Works DW database on the localhost server

This is the role for which the CubePermissions are to be listed

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of one or more SSAS Databases from the specified server.
This is the server object from which the database(s) are to be retrieved. You can get a server object using the get-ASServer cmdlet.
This is the name of the SSAS Server from which to list databases.
This parameter can be used to limit the returned databases to a single database that exactly matches the name or a set of databases that matches a wildcard parameter.
This is the server object from which the database(s) are to be retrieved. You can get a server object using the get-ASServer cmdlet.
This is the name of the SSAS Server from which to list databases.
This parameter can be used to limit the returned databases to a single database that exactly matches the name or a set of databases that matches a wildcard parameter.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the Adventure Works DW database from the locahost server

The name of the Cube from which to return the dimension object.

The name of the database from which to return the dimension object.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the locks that exists on the specified server.
Executes a DISCOVER_LOCKS request and returns the results to PowerShell
This flag causes only READ locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
Returns locks that have a status of GRANTED
Returns locks that have a status of WAITING
This flag causes only WRITE locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
This flag causes only SESSION locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
Returns locks that have been granted for a minimum of the specified number of milliseconds
Returns locks associated with the specified SPID
Returns locks associated with the specified TransactionID
This is an optional parameter which passes an XML fragment through to the restrictions parameter for the underlying DISCOVER_LOCKS request.
This is the name of the SSAS server to query for locking information
This flag causes only READ locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
Returns locks that have a status of GRANTED
Returns locks that have a status of WAITING
This flag causes only WRITE locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
This flag causes only SESSION locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
Returns locks that have been granted for a minimum of the specified number of milliseconds
Returns locks associated with the specified SPID
Returns locks associated with the specified TransactionID
This is the server object that should be queried for the lock information. This parameter can be piped in to this cmdlet
This flag causes only READ locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
Returns locks that have a status of GRANTED
Returns locks that have a status of WAITING
This flag causes only WRITE locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
This flag causes only SESSION locks to be returned, this is a Bit flag and can be used in conjunction with the other *_LOCK parameters to return multiple lock types.
Returns locks that have been granted for a minimum of the specified number of milliseconds
Returns locks associated with the specified SPID
Returns locks associated with the specified TransactionID
This is an optional parameter which passes an XML fragment through to the restrictions parameter for the underlying DISCOVER_LOCKS request.
This is the name of the SSAS server to query for locking information
This is the server object that should be queried for the lock information. This parameter can be piped in to this cmdlet

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all the write locks on the localhost. Write locks are taken out during a processing operation.

maml:description.maml:para: This cmdlet returns a Role object from the specified Analysis Services database.
If specified only the role with this ID will be returned. If omitted, all roles in the specified database will be returned.
If specified only the role with this name will be returned. If omitted, all roles in the specified database will be returned.
The name of the Server from which to return the role(s)
The name of the Database from which to return the role(s)
If specified only the role with this ID will be returned. If omitted, all roles in the specified database will be returned.
If specified only the role with this name will be returned. If omitted, all roles in the specified database will be returned.
The name of the Server from which to return the role(s)
The name of the Database from which to return the role(s)
This cmdlet is used to get a reference to an Analysis Services server.
The name of the SSAS server.
The name of the SSAS server.

dev:remarks.maml:para: returns a server object for the server on the local machine.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a collection of the current Analysis Services sessions
Runs a DISCOVER_SESSIONS XMLA Discover command against the specified server and returns the results as a list of session objects.
This is an XML fragment containing XMLA restrictions that are passed through to the DISCOVER_SESSIONS call.
Get only sessions relating to this database
The name of the Analysis Service Server against which a DISCOVER_SESSIONS command is run.
This is an SSAS server object which can be passed in via the pipeline.
This is an XML fragment containing XMLA restrictions that are passed through to the DISCOVER_SESSIONS call.
Get only sessions relating to this database
The name of the Analysis Service Server against which a DISCOVER_SESSIONS command is run.
This is an SSAS server object which can be passed in via the pipeline.
Strongly typed session objects

dev:remarks.maml:para: Discovers the sessions on the localhost server

command:commandLine.command:commandText: SessionID UserName LastCommand --------- -------- ----------- B9F64043-9F74-4EB... localhost\Administrator DISCOVER_XML_META... 8FCABD61-32C2-4DC... localhost\Administrator DISCOVER_SESSIONS

dev:remarks.maml:para: Accepts the server object from the pipeline and returns a list of sessions.

command:commandLine.command:commandText: SessionID UserName LastCommand --------- -------- ----------- B9F64043-9F74-4EB... localhost\Administrator DISCOVER_XML_META... 8FCABD61-32C2-4DC... localhost\Administrator DISCOVER_SESSIONS

The name of the server from which to get
The name of the server from which to get
Returns a list of the available event subclasses with their descriptions
The name of the server to query for the trace event subclasses.
The name of the server to query for the trace event subclasses.

dev:remarks.maml:para: returns a list of the trace subclasses from the localhost server.

command:commandLine.command:commandText:
EventName : Audit Server Starts And Stops EventID : 4 EventDescription : Records service shut down, start, and pause activities. SubclassName : Instance Shutdown SubclassId : 1
EventName : Audit Server Starts And Stops EventID : 4 EventDescription : Records service shut down, start, and pause activities. SubclassName : Instance Started SubclassId : 2

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Table of Subclass IDs and Names --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-AsTraceSubclass localhost | Format-Table EventID, EventName, SubclassID, SubclassName - auto

dev:remarks.maml:para: Outputs a table of the Event Sub classes

command:commandLine.command:commandText: EventID EventName SubclassId SubclassName ------- --------- ---------- ------------ 4 Audit Server Starts And Stops 1 Instance Shutdown 4 Audit Server Starts And Stops 2 Instance Started 4 Audit Server Starts And Stops 3 Instance Paused 4 Audit Server Starts And Stops 4 Instance Continued 19 Audit Backup/Restore Event 1 Backup 19 Audit Backup/Restore Event 2 Restore 19 Audit Backup/Restore Event 3 Synchronize 19 Audit Backup/Restore Event 4 Detach 19 Audit Backup/Restore Event 5 Attach 5 Progress Report Begin 1 Process 5 Progress Report Begin 2 Merge 5 Progress Report Begin 3 Delete 5 Progress Report Begin 4 DeleteOldAggregations

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Simple Query --------------
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-AsMdx localhost "Adventure Works DW" "SELECT [Measures].[Internet Sales Amount] on 0 FROM [Adventure Works]"

maml:description.maml:para: Generates an XMLA script for the specified object.
Setting this flag Will cause the cmdlet to return a CREATE script instead of an ALTER script.
This is the object for which the XMLA script will be generated
Excludes dependant objects only scripting the specified object
Excludes permissions from the XMLA script
Excludes partitions from a Cube script
Setting this flag Will cause the cmdlet to return a CREATE script instead of an ALTER script.
This is the object for which the XMLA script will be generated
Excludes dependant objects only scripting the specified object
Excludes permissions from the XMLA script
Excludes partitions from a Cube script

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Get a Dimension XMLA alter script --------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the XMLA Alter script as a string to the $script variable

command:commandLine.command:commandText: <Alter AllowCreate="true" ObjectExpansion="ExpandFull" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/analysisservices/2003/engine "> <Object> <DatabaseID>Adventure Works DW 2008</DatabaseID> <DimensionID>Dim Geography</DimensionID> </Object> <ObjectDefinition> <Dimension xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns :ddl2="http://schemas.microsoft.com/analysisservices/2003/engine/2" xmlns:ddl2_2="http://schemas.microsoft.com/analysis services/2003/engine/2/2"> <ID>Dim Geography</ID> <Name>Geography</Name> <Annotations> <Annotation> ...

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Create an Xmla File --------------
command:example.dev:code: get-AsDimension localhost\sql08 "Adventure Works DW 2008" "Geography" | new-AsScript $dim > c:\data\DimGeography.xmla

dev:remarks.maml:para: This script pipes the output of the new-AsScript cmdlet to the DimGeography.xmla file.
